nodes.text: The Galactic Empire erected a scout post on the Mid Rim planet Coyerti around 3 ABY. The post consisted of a collection of tents and perimeter sensors managed by a small unit of Imperial soldiers assigned to provide support to the Empire's budding offensive against the Coyerti natives.

The scout post was built on the Mid Rim jungle world Coyerti by the Galactic Empire, in order to provide logistical aid during the Empire's ongoing offensive against the Coyerti around 3 ABY. The post's resources included stormtroopers, at least one of which was armed with a grenade launcher, and several speeders that were rigged with homing beacons.

In 3 ABY, the scout post was attacked by two squads of the Alliance to Restore the Republic's 61st Mobile Infantry, each led by First Sergeant Hazram Namir and Sergeant Zab, during the rebels' campaign to protect the natives. The Imperial soldiers assigned to the post were caught unaware and were eliminated within ten minutes after a brief skirmish. Immediately after the battle, the rebel soldiers destroyed the remaining equipment at the outpost with detonators. Although Zab requested that the speeder bikes assigned to the base would be utilized by Twilight Company, Namir declined the request, reasoning that the speeder bikes were equipped with homing beacons that would lead to the rebels' capture. Shortly thereafter, Twilight Company fled into the jungle, aiming to escape the inevitable TIE/sa bomber sorties that would respond to the attack.
The Imperial scout post first appeared in the 2015 novel Battlefront: Twilight Company, written by Alexander Freed.
